citations.narrative:
On July 16th, 2022, the facility documented that during a guest interaction with the Savannah cats, a member of the
public was bitten. The bite resulted in a wound that broke the skin. Because the facility was unsure which of the three cats
in the enclosure caused the injury, all three cats were required to be quarantined for six months.
Inadequate handling or control of animals during public interactions can lead to injury of the public and the animals.
Additionally, animals involved in injuring the public could be at risk of euthanasia. The facility must ensure that animals
are handled so there is minimal risk of harm to the animal and to the public, with sufficient distance and/or barriers
between the animal and the general viewing public to assure the safety of animals and the public during exhibition and/or
encounters.
To be corrected from this day forward.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
End Section

narrative:
2.131(c)(1)  Critical
   
Handling of animals. 
On July 16th, 2022, the facility documented that during a guest interaction with the Savannah cats, a member of the 
public was bitten. The bite resulted in a wound that broke the skin. Because the facility was unsure which of the three cats 
in the enclosure caused the injury, all three cats were required to be quarantined for six months. 
Inadequate handling or control of animals during public interactions can lead to injury of the public and the animals. 
Additionally, animals involved in injuring the public could be at risk of euthanasia. The facility must ensure that animals 
are handled so there is minimal risk of harm to the animal and to the public, with sufficient distance and/or barriers 
between the animal and the general viewing public to assure the safety of animals and the public during exhibition and/or 
encounters. 
To be corrected from this day forward. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives. 
 
End Section
